body:
1) replying on a tangentially related closed bug is not really useful
2) this seems entirely to be working as designed, you cannot make c-archive
into a shared object, but c-shared you can
On 20/12/2015 10:57 am, "pjbgtnj" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I'm trying to make a static library in go (devel +97f854c) that exports a
> function that gets called by an apache mod (apxs) and get the following
> error. I compile my go program with "go build -buildmode c-archive
> libxxx.go". When try to comple and link with my apache mod using "apxs -c
> mod_authnz_xxx.c libxxx.a" I get:
>
> *** Warning: Linking the shared library mod_authnz_xxx.la against the
> *** static library libxxx.a is not portable!
> /usr/bin/ld: libxxx.a(go.o): relocation R_X86_64_TPOFF32 against
> `runtime.tlsg' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with
> -fPIC
> libxxx.a: could not read symbols: Bad value
> collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
> apxs:Error: Command failed with rc=65536
> .
> make: *** [mod_authnz_xxx.la] Error 1
>
> I added the "-x" option shows that my go code is compiled with -fPIC but
> this appears to be a problem related to the fact it's a static library
> (using a c-shared library works).
>
